issue.title: Fix x describe pod which is not in mesh

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR needs to be rebased before being merged

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
When use `x describe` to describe unmeshed pod, using or not using `ignoreUnmeshed` flag will alwasy try to get config dump from the pod like:
```
x describe po -n notinj helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp --ignoreUnmeshed
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision:
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
--------------------
2022-10-08T03:49:11.471548Z	error	klog	an error occurred forwarding 51246 -> 15000: error forwarding port 15000 to pod 9c991cd2d1345f4e7ac59e126136dfb5687641f45dc6a80f2cf223fc798d6205, uid : exit status 1: 2022/10/08 03:49:11 socat[30618] E connect(16, AF=2 127.0.0.1:15000, 16): Connection refused
--------------------
2022-10-08T03:49:11.471688Z	error	klog	lost connection to pod
```

This fix is to stop getting config dump when the pod is not in mesh, and optimize the display.

The result will be like:
```
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision: 
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
WARNING: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp is not part of mesh; no Istio sidecar
--------------------
Service: helloworld
   Port: http 5000/HTTP targets pod port 5000
WARNING: no Istio policies to describe since the pod is not in mesh
--------------------
No other Istio configurations to be described since the pod is not in mesh.
```
and `ignoreUnmeshed`:
```
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision: 
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
--------------------
Service: helloworld
   Port: http 5000/HTTP targets pod port 5000
```

issue.title: ambient: Refactor workload discovery to be more efficient and support on-demand

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR needs to be rebased before being merged

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
This refactors the WDS to compute the WorkloadInfo's on the fly based on events, and XDS handling is just piping those out to clients efficiently. This makes the XDS requests very quick.

In addition, modify the generator to support both on-demand and wildcard clients. This will, in the future, be used to support on-demand ztunnel implementations.

Following https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MAF6oJi3vff4J2dUolI5_Edzw66UV_lmooACR2oqBWo/edit?resourcekey=0-NdRHnxWpMMdk7jkEnqbB9Q, resource names have been switched from Pod name to IP address.

Hi @kanurag94. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [istio](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

pull_request.title: Fix config key hashcode collision issue.
pull_request.body:
Now, the hashcode of config whose namespace is ns-foo and name is abc is equal to the config  whose namespace is cns-foo and name is ab. The reason is that we can't distinguish the boundary between namespace and name.

This pr add separator / to avoid collision. For better readable, I move namespace in the front of name.

**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [ ] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [X] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [X] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [X] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

issue.title: Fix x describe pod which is not in mesh

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR needs to be rebased before being merged

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
When use `x describe` to describe unmeshed pod, using or not using `ignoreUnmeshed` flag will alwasy try to get config dump from the pod like:
```
x describe po -n notinj helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp --ignoreUnmeshed
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision:
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
--------------------
2022-10-08T03:49:11.471548Z	error	klog	an error occurred forwarding 51246 -> 15000: error forwarding port 15000 to pod 9c991cd2d1345f4e7ac59e126136dfb5687641f45dc6a80f2cf223fc798d6205, uid : exit status 1: 2022/10/08 03:49:11 socat[30618] E connect(16, AF=2 127.0.0.1:15000, 16): Connection refused
--------------------
2022-10-08T03:49:11.471688Z	error	klog	lost connection to pod
```

This fix is to stop getting config dump when the pod is not in mesh, and optimize the display.

The result will be like:
```
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision: 
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
WARNING: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp is not part of mesh; no Istio sidecar
--------------------
Service: helloworld
   Port: http 5000/HTTP targets pod port 5000
WARNING: no Istio policies to describe since the pod is not in mesh
--------------------
No other Istio configurations to be described since the pod is not in mesh.
```
and `ignoreUnmeshed`:
```
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision: 
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
--------------------
Service: helloworld
   Port: http 5000/HTTP targets pod port 5000
```

issue.title: ambient: Refactor workload discovery to be more efficient and support on-demand

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR needs to be rebased before being merged

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
This refactors the WDS to compute the WorkloadInfo's on the fly based on events, and XDS handling is just piping those out to clients efficiently. This makes the XDS requests very quick.

In addition, modify the generator to support both on-demand and wildcard clients. This will, in the future, be used to support on-demand ztunnel implementations.

Following https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MAF6oJi3vff4J2dUolI5_Edzw66UV_lmooACR2oqBWo/edit?resourcekey=0-NdRHnxWpMMdk7jkEnqbB9Q, resource names have been switched from Pod name to IP address.

comment.body:
Hi @kanurag94. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [istio](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) to skip this step.

Once the patch is verified, the new status will be reflected by the `ok-to-test` label.

I understand the commands that are listed [here](https://go.k8s.io/bot-commands?repo=istio%2Fistio).

<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/guide/pull-requests.md). pull_request.title: Fix config key hashcode collision issue.
pull_request.body:
Now, the hashcode of config whose namespace is ns-foo and name is abc is equal to the config  whose namespace is cns-foo and name is ab. The reason is that we can't distinguish the boundary between namespace and name.

This pr add separator / to avoid collision. For better readable, I move namespace in the front of name.

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [X] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [ ] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure

- [X] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

issue.title: Fix x describe pod which is not in mesh

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR needs to be rebased before being merged

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
When use `x describe` to describe unmeshed pod, using or not using `ignoreUnmeshed` flag will alwasy try to get config dump from the pod like:
```
x describe po -n notinj helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp --ignoreUnmeshed
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision:
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
--------------------
2022-10-08T03:49:11.471548Z	error	klog	an error occurred forwarding 51246 -> 15000: error forwarding port 15000 to pod 9c991cd2d1345f4e7ac59e126136dfb5687641f45dc6a80f2cf223fc798d6205, uid : exit status 1: 2022/10/08 03:49:11 socat[30618] E connect(16, AF=2 127.0.0.1:15000, 16): Connection refused
--------------------
2022-10-08T03:49:11.471688Z	error	klog	lost connection to pod
```

This fix is to stop getting config dump when the pod is not in mesh, and optimize the display.

The result will be like:
```
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision: 
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
WARNING: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp is not part of mesh; no Istio sidecar
--------------------
Service: helloworld
   Port: http 5000/HTTP targets pod port 5000
WARNING: no Istio policies to describe since the pod is not in mesh
--------------------
No other Istio configurations to be described since the pod is not in mesh.
```
and `ignoreUnmeshed`:
```
Pod: helloworld-v1-78b9f5c87f-jcmhp
   Pod Revision: 
   Pod Ports: 5000 (helloworld)
--------------------
Service: helloworld
   Port: http 5000/HTTP targets pod port 5000
```

issue.title: ambient: Refactor workload discovery to be more efficient and support on-demand

labels.name: needs-rebase
labels.description: Indicates a PR needs to be rebased before being merged

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
This refactors the WDS to compute the WorkloadInfo's on the fly based on events, and XDS handling is just piping those out to clients efficiently. This makes the XDS requests very quick.

In addition, modify the generator to support both on-demand and wildcard clients. This will, in the future, be used to support on-demand ztunnel implementations.

Following https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MAF6oJi3vff4J2dUolI5_Edzw66UV_lmooACR2oqBWo/edit?resourcekey=0-NdRHnxWpMMdk7jkEnqbB9Q, resource names have been switched from Pod name to IP address.

Hi @kanurag94. Thanks for your PR.

I'm waiting for a [istio](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) member to verify that this patch is reasonable to test. If it is, they should reply with `/ok-to-test` on its own line. Until that is done, I will not automatically test new commits in this PR, but the usual testing commands by org members will still work. Regular contributors should [join the org](https://github.com/orgs/istio/people) to skip this step.

pull_request.title: Fix config key hashcode collision issue.
pull_request.body:
Now, the hashcode of config whose namespace is ns-foo and name is abc is equal to the config  whose namespace is cns-foo and name is ab. The reason is that we can't distinguish the boundary between namespace and name.

This pr add separator / to avoid collision. For better readable, I move namespace in the front of name.

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [ ] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Installation

- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [X] Security
- [ ] Test and Release

- [X] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

issue.title: Make sure identity is in CSR for istiod CA

labels.name: size/M
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**

While browsing the [istio-csr](https://github.com/cert-manager/istio-csr/blob/c2e12cd702cca8272366ebccce36aedfd53af2ac/pkg/server/auth.go#L82) repository I see that they check to make sure that they extract from the `metadata.Pair` the `Authorization: Bearer <jwt>` token to create the SPIFFE identity. This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.

**To help us figure out who should review this PR, please put an X in all the areas that this PR affects.**

- [ ] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs

**Please check any characteristics that apply to this pull request.**

- [X] Does not have any [user-facing](https://github.com/istio/istio/tree/master/releasenotes#when-to-add-release-notes) changes. This may include CLI changes, API changes, behavior changes, performance improvements, etc.

This identity is then used to checked against the incoming CSR's SAN URI, expecting a match. If a match is found, a certificate can be created. If not, a certificate is not.

I think this would help create a more robust 0-trust environment.
